page.title: 04Conservation in Dean
page.content: A large part of Upper Dean is a conservation area. It comprises a number of loosely spaced building groups arranged around an old road pattern and situated on the lower slopes of a very gentle valley. The pattern of narrow, curving lanes is emphasised by hedges and the close penetration of the countryside into every part of the area provide an attractive setting for the old buildings. Trees are especially prominent around the church and 2 old houses, Dean House and the Grange (now a school), whilst there are 2 open areas in the heart of the village. The church dating from 14th Century is a dominant feature, it's fine spire forming a focus to the area.Dean House and Farmhouse are listed and others are on the supplementary list, all adding to the beauty of Dean.
